response_requirements.initial_response_description: Custodian must provide records or deny in writing within 3 working days (NOTE: SB25-077 proposing 5 days was VETOED April 2025)
response_requirements.final_response_notes: May extend 3-day period for up to 7 additional working days if extenuating circumstances (total 10 working days max)
response_requirements.extension_notes: Must provide written notice of extension within initial 3-day period and state reasons
response_requirements.vetoed_bill_note: SB25-077 (5+10 day timeline) vetoed by Governor Polis April 17, 2025 - current 3+7 day timeline remains

fee_structure.search_fee_notes: May charge for research and retrieval of records

exemptions.description: Records specifically made confidential by law
Trade secrets and confidential commercial information
Attorney work product and attorney-client privileged communications

appeal_process.first_level_notes: No administrative appeal; may petition district court
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Court may award attorney fees and costs

requester_requirements.request_format_notes: Written application required; must describe record with sufficient specificity to enable custodian to locate

agency_obligations.records_officer_notes: Custodian has custody and control of public records
agency_obligations.suitable_place_required: Must make available suitable place for inspection; cannot remove originals without permission

primary_sources: Colo. Rev. Stat. Title 24, Article 72, Part 2
validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields manually verified. Current law: 3 working day response with 7 day extension (10 max). SB25-077 proposing 5+10 days vetoed April 2025. Typical $0.25/page copies. May charge for research/retrieval. Written application required. District court enforcement with attorney fees. Recent veto demonstrates state commitment to faster response times.
